data.title: Glynco Campus Life
data.meta_description: Read about what to expect while staying at Glynco, including student activities, services and campus policies.
data.text:
While assigned at the Federal Law Enforcement Training Centers (FLETC), students may participate in organized events and activities designed to complement the training experience. Monthly, the Student Recreation Program coordinates a schedule encompassing a broad range of organized recreational activities. The scope of the program includes trips to professional and minor league sporting events, concerts, golf outings, various cultural, environmental and historical tours, intramural sports and organized runs. Available facilities on-Center includes tennis, racquetball, indoor/outdoor basketball, sand volleyball courts, a softball field, certified jogging trails, indoor and outdoor swimming pools as well as exercise and weight rooms. A wide variety of recreational aerobics are offered, including cycling, yoga, aerobic strength, and cardio training.

The geographical location of the FLETC, Glynco area lends itself to outdoor activity interests. The surrounding area is considered prime golfing: Jekyll Island, Sea Island, and Saint Simons Island are just a short drive and all offer championship quality golf courses. For the adventurous, you can sign out canoes, kayaks, Paddle Boards and associated equipment on a temporary basis through the Student Recreation Office; advance reservations are required. There are a variety of waterways, parks, and pristine nature areas within close proximity. The Student Recreation Office also coordinates a variety of guided excursions of the cultural, environmental and historical sites in the region.

The Student Recreation Program coordinates shuttle transportation to various local and regional sites including, local malls and shopping areas in Savannah, Brunswick, St. Simons Island Pier, Jekyll Island, and St. Augustine, FL. These recreation activities are offered for all assigned personnel. All FLETC students and staff are invited and encouraged to participate.

Contact Information

For information contact the Student Recreation Office, Town House Building 396 Room 200 & 201.

Phone: (912) 261-3764 or (912) 267-3099 (*dial last 4 digits when on post)

Email: Fletc-StudentRecreation@fletc.dhs.gov

Providing multi-level wellness solutions to restore, sustain, and enhance the health and well-being of the FLETC community.

Student Available Programs

Health-Fitness Appraisal

A measurement of physical characteristics to establish benchmarks and evaluate changes over time.

Freshstart®

Is a group-based tobacco cessation support program offered by the American Cancer Society and facilitated by the Employee Wellness Program. The program works toward helping smokers develop a plan for a successful quit attempt.

Wellness Education

Provides Lunch-n-Learns, wellness classes at your staff meetings, small group classes, and 1-on-1 wellness coaching to empower individuals and groups with the attitudes, knowledge, and skills to implement behaviors to enhance well-being.

Lunch-n-Learns

Contact the Wellness Coordinator directly to schedule classes for staff meetings or to participate in small group classes or wellness coaching. These are also announced on FLETC-Connect.

Events & Activities

Themed health awareness observances, health fairs, wellness challenges, blood drives, and various wellness activities to engage the FLETC community and support a culture of wellness.

FLETC maintains computer laboratories specifically for student use. The labs are equipped with the latest computers with appropriate software including Microsoft Office. The lab hours are as follows:

Building 262, Multimedia Center and Library

Hours:

Monday – Friday: 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Saturday and Holidays: 8:00 a. m. – 5:00 p.m.

Sundays: 10:00 a. m. – 7:00 p.m.

Bldg 262, Room 1008

This lab is always open during building hours, but unavailable when an official class is utilizing the room.

Building 212, Room 119

Hours:

Monday – Thursday: 4:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.

Friday and Saturday: closed

Sundays: 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Closed Holidays.

FLETC policy prohibits taking identifiable facial photos of students or staff without prior permission of the individuals involved. In addition, it is against the law for certain agency personnel to be photographed under any circumstances. (This policy stems from a need to protect criminal investigators who may perform undercover work.) Although this policy does not preclude “fond memory” type photographs or photography necessary as a part of a course of instruction, students and their visitors are required to adhere to this policy and remain sensitive to its purpose and intent. Please report all suspicious circumstances involving photographic film images being taken to the FLETC Security and Emergency Management Division at (912) 267-2102. Types of incidents include, but are not limited to: Anyone seeming to be capturing images of individuals without their knowledge; Anyone making a detailed record of all or any part of the FLETC installation; Anyone attempting to obtain class pictures that they themselves are not physically in.

Report Suspicious Activity: (912) 267-2102
